name: Europe Israel Public Affairs
goal:
EIPA works in Brussels to strengthen the EU - Israel bilateral relations and fosters dialogue between the EU and Israel on issues of mutual concern in the fields of global security, Middle East peace, and human rights. We develop networks between parliamentarians, civil servants and staffers and their counterparts in Israel, facilitate dialogue and create events and opportunities enabling stronger political, economic and cultural ties between the EU and the State of Israel.

EIPA is located at 109 rue Froissart in offices run by the European Union Jewish Building (EUJB). In addition to EIPA AND the EJA, there are a number of offices and organisations dealing with Jewish matters such as European Union Jewish Community Centre and Chana which deals with Jewish women issues.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Borders and Security, Culture, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Trade
euInitiatives:
Following EU Foreign Policy ( Foreign Affairs Committee, Security and Defence Committee) and International Trade Committee;
European Neighbourhood Policy - Southern Partnership
Development Aid
